intro: Corydalis heteropetala subsp. bayerniana, commonly known as the Bavarian corydalis, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant has slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady areas. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after addition to gardens and botanical collections.
